channel.title: Wolfenstein: The New World Order
channel.description:
Apparently bethsoft is making a re-imagining of wolfenstien 3d (similar to doom to doom 3)
the big story change (who would've guessed?) is the fascists won the war and BJ Blazkowicz is tasked with the "impossible counter-strike operation"
[url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?feature=player_embedded&v=OEplYCYEDn8']Reveal trailer seems hot[/url][/size]
![](upload://5ghXeesioMlcX8PUe2jtNL1nePb.jpeg) ![](upload://8AMnndqbdeBXlaHuZVjNyEFscr8.jpeg)
opinions? will it be a cod-clone like wolfenstien 2009? or will it be open world-ish like most well-made SP games lately; [u][b]will it be free of ironsights??[/b][/u][/size]
also, yes that was the statue of liberty getting nuked at 0:48

item.title: Wolfenstein: The New World Order
item.dc:creator: Massey
item.description:
Yeah, even the documents and such don’t go far into depth. I felt that particular segment was lack luster and thrown in more as a hail to RTCW and its plot more than anything.

It was fun enough, but rather anti-climatic imo.

Read full topic

item.title: Wolfenstein: The New World Order
item.dc:creator: Pyroclase
item.description:
Agreed. It’s got fun gameplay, great level design, an amazing aesthetic, and was just generally fun.

The only thing I don’t get is that I’m pretty sure I missed a big chunk of the plot. I can only assume I missed some notes or things, but…

Why was there a giant monster in the vault? Aside from the obvious, I mean. And why exactly, if King Otto was using ancient technology to try and take over europe, did he fail?

Read full topic

item.title: Wolfenstein: The New World Order
item.dc:creator: Massey
item.description:
So Old Blood is a pretty good take on the series. It’s a bit short, only 5-7 hours of gameplay, and it isn’t as character complex as TNO, but it’s definitely fun and a great addition. I give it a solid 7/10.

Also, dem pipe takedowns mmm.

Read full topic

item.title: Wolfenstein: The New World Order
item.dc:creator: Dreadmoth
item.description:
Digital version is out

Dat regional pricing for Wolfenstein: The Old Blood on Steam… :fffuuu:

US price: $19.99 USD
AU price: $39.95 USD

Can get around it by buying on Green Man Gaming: $19.99 USD (or $15.59 on the GMG VIP page)

Seems to be region-locked or something on GamersGate - can look at the game page but the buy button doesn’t appear.

Read full topic

item.title: Wolfenstein: The New World Order
item.dc:creator: GilCMassey
item.description:
https://m.ign.com/articles/2015/03/04/bethesda-reveals-wolfenstein-the-new-blood

Hmmmm…did I see what I think I saw? I think I saw what I think I saw.

What do you guys think? I think it’s nice. A stand alone prequel, based off of Castle Wolfenstein. I wonder if it’ll be a total remake of the 2002(?) game, or if it’s a new story all on its own. I kinda hope for a mix, but just from what’s ahown, it isn’t looking like it’ll be like RTCW, but a little more story friendly to TNO and more realistically founded (as realistic as super nazi’s are anyways.)

Course, I still want to know if he’s gone Bethesda you whores of Hell and its demon spawn.

Read full topic

item.title: Wolfenstein: The New World Order
item.dc:creator: Dreadmoth
item.description:
Kairouseki:

Some of the console commands are locked too which doesn’t make it easy.

You can bypass the lock on some of them by using them together with the cvarrandom command, e.g.:

cvarrandom r_skippostprocess 1 1

Replace “r_skippostprocess” with whatever cvar you’re trying to alter (some have to be set when the game starts or require a renderer restart to apply correctly).

I think the numbers after the command define the range of random numbers the cvar might be set to - “1 1” is only 1, “0 0” is only 0, “0 100” might be a number in the range of 0 - 100

Read full topic

item.title: Wolfenstein: The New World Order
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
If there’s one thing idtech has down it’s the enemies’ reactions to getting shot. It was great in Rage and it’s great in this game.

And the performance hit I get during cutscenes seems to start if I set the “quality” option to high or ultra. On medium the framerate is fine pretty much the entire time. So something is enabled on high that kills performance. Wonder if someone will find what it is. Some of the console commands are locked too which doesn’t make it easy.

Read full topic

item.title: Wolfenstein: The New World Order
item.dc:creator: papernick
item.description:
k3nny1550:

Okay, so I got this game during the Steam sale and started playing it for my livestream. HOLY SHIT THIS GAME IS GOOD. Wow. Jaw on the floor.

You know that if you kill commanders silently nobody will be able to activate the alarm and you’ll have to deal with less soldiers? I watched about half an hour of your stream so I don’t know if you actually realise it later.

item.title: Wolfenstein: The New World Order
item.dc:creator: Dreadmoth
item.description:
I think it’s supposed to install the DirectX June 2010 and Visual C++ 2010 redistributables (maybe Visual C++ 2008 as well)

You should be able to find them in the “_CommonRedist” folder under your W:TNO install directory.

Read full topic

item.title: Wolfenstein: The New World Order
item.dc:creator: Kairouseki
item.description:
I don’t know if there is or not but some games have files that should do that but don’t. I would look in the Steam folder for a redist folder and if there’s one in there run the stuff in it.

Read full topic
